description.value: This code system contains codes for documenting the various attributes of a Digital Certificate

definition.value: The server infrastructure will be using a TLS(Transport Layer Security) required to present a certificate as part of the initial secure connection TLS supports many different methods for exchanging keys, encrypting data, and authenticating message integrity.
This type of certificate is used to verify the identity of a group.
This type of certificate is used to verify the identity of a device.
A group certificate is used to verify the identity of an individual.
A digital certificate use of a digital signature demonstrates the intent of the signer to validate the content of the message.
A digital certificate use of a keyEncipherment demonstrates the intent to utilize the subject public key to establish an encrypted connection between a browser or user's computer and a server.
Certificate-based authentication refers to the use of a Digital Certificate to identify a user, machine, or device before granting access to a resource.
The digital certificate standard defines the framework of the public key certificates and the atribute certitficates. It also defines a framework for the provision of authentication services.
